questionListItems.title: Is MGS facilities available for rental?

answer.body: Yes, they are available for rental. Please email us for further discussions.

questionListItems.title: How do I make a report on noise from the school after school hours or weekends?

answer.body: We apologised for any inconvenice caused. Please email your concerns to mgps@moe.edu.sg or mgss@moe.edu.sg.

questionListItems.title: How do I apply for a school locker for my child/ward?

answer.body: Please fill in the locker rental form at this link.

questionListItems.title: Would my daughter be at a disadvantage during the DSA exercise if she is not a Singaporean?

answer.body: Your child’s nationality does not matter in the DSA exercise. Our assessment is based on talents and ability to cope with the rigour of the school curriculum.

questionListItems.title: Where can I find the list of Talent Areas for DSA? Will the list be the same as the previous year?

answer.body:
The list of DSA Talent Areas for MGS will be published on the school website after MOE’s announcement of the DSA exercise (usually in late April/early May).


The list of DSA Talent Areas and selection criteria/processes are subject to changes each year.

questionListItems.title: When will I know if I have been shortlisted for the test / audition / trial / interview?

answer.body: All shortlisted applicants will be informed via email to attend selection tests/auditions/trials and be provided with further details at the end of June/early July.

questionListItems.title: What is the minimum score needed to be shortlisted for DSA trial / audition?

answer.body:
The DSA Exercise allows students to gain admission to a DSA school via talent area(s) before PSLE. All applicants will be assessed on their talents and ability to cope with the school curriculum.

Please refer to our school website in late April/early May for the full details of the DSA Exercise.

questionListItems.title: What documents do I need to submit together with the application form?

answer.body: Application will be online via MOE’s DSA-Sec Portal. During this stage, there is no need to submit any documents yet. Only shortlisted applicants need to submit them upon request by schools.

questionListItems.title: What are the criteria for entry for DSA through STEM / English language talent areas? Does my child need to take any selection Test?

answer.body: The shortlisting criteria comprises strong academic results and a basket of holistic indicators. Shortlisted candidates will have to undergo a selection process which includes a domain assessment task, an individual interview and an essay writing component. More information can be found on the MGS website.

questionListItems.title: Is there a DSA quota for each CCA or on the whole?

answer.body: There is no fixed quota. The objective of DSA is to identify talent, taking into consideration the student’s interest and long term development potential.

questionListItems.title: If my child gets in through DSA, must my child join the CCA for 4 years? What if her interest changes?

answer.body:
Yes, your child is obliged to contribute in that DSA Talent Area and hence must remain in the same CCA so that we can develop her full potential over four years.


If choice of CCA is important, then your child should avoid applying for entry via DSA Sports or Music as the above conditions apply.

questionListItems.title: I am posted to another school through my DSA options but I am keen to appeal for a place in MGS. Am I allowed to appeal?

answer.body:
As a DSA student, you are not allowed to transfer to another school after the release of the PSLE results as you are expected to honour your commitment to your posted DSA school, for the duration of the programme that you are admitted into.

Access the MOE DSA site for more information.

questionListItems.title: Are there Talent Areas which are more popular and see a higher number of DSA applicants?
Will my child be guaranteed a place in the school team if she comes in via DSA?

answer.body:
The school team is selected only prior to the team registration for the National School Games. The CCA teachers and the coach will access the players and choose those who are ready to represent the school.


Generally, most DSA students qualify for the school team due to their good attitude, talent, ability and sustained commitment to training.

questionListItems.title: What opportunities are given to Secondary school students in the performing arts CCAs?

answer.body:
Besides the biennial SYF Arts Presentation, students in the Performing Arts CCA have many platforms where they are involved in different ways, besides performance. For example, students may be involved in production, choreography and leading sections in practices and rehearsals. Platforms are internal and external school events such as Founder’s Day, MGS Sunday at CCMC, Student Leaders’ Investiture, public performances with VIA partners to reach out to the community.


Under the guidance of our experienced instructors, they also get to take part in competitions and when they are at their peak , they may be sent for external MOE courses such as the conductor’s course, to hone their skills.
